overview: "I picked up the telephone one day and somehow got cross-connected into a conversation between a couple talking about the simple experiences of their day which included the line 'Your daughter is sleeping'. I felt as a voyeur, hearing and seeing things I was not meant to see and hear. Somehow that became a metaphor for voyeuristic filmmaking, as troubling and imperfect as that experience can be." â€“RM
title: Your Daughter Is Sleeping
